intro: Gonostegia pentandra subsp. wightii, commonly known as the Wight's gonostegia, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
